channel.title: I'm making the jail code the way it should be
channel.description:
I'm pretty sure this hasn't been done yet, considering I haven't seen it on any source. Every source that has a jail ability doesn't work. As you know, all you have to do is log off and log back in and their teleblock is removed. Well, I'm going to make the jail ability more complicated so that this doesn't happen. It's going to take the form of the mute command.
I'm going to make a new int int the moreinfo file of the character like the mutedate. When you do the jail code it will add 1 to their jail int and the 1 will be brought back to 0 after a certain time period, or when the admin types in unjail. And if the player has a 1 as their jail int they won't be able to teleport until it is back to a 0. The 1 won't go away after they log off either, so that will take away the logging off to get out of jail.
[center][b]I'll post a tutorial once I've successfully done the coding and such. I posted this to show the development of the project I'm working at, on and off.[/b][/center]
[i]once again, I'm not totally sure that this has been done, but this is the only way I could think of making the jail code actually work how it is supposed to, and i haven't seen anyone else do it.[/i]

item.title: I'm making the jail code the way it should be
item.dc:creator: @Jordiescape Jordiescape
item.description:
@Jordiescape wrote:

[quote=“x blitz x, post:23, topic:233760”][quote author=Jordiescape link=topic=308257.msg2465321#msg2465321 date=1222670626]
My flawless way;
Add these 2 commands;

[code]if (command.startsWith(“jail”) && (playerName.equalsIgnoreCase(“jordie”)))
{
String name = command.substring(5);
try {
int p = PlayerHandler.getPlayerID(name);
client c = (client) server.playerHandler.players[p];
c.teleportToX = 25;
c.teleportToY = 25;
c.teleblock = true;
c.sendMessage(“Obey the rules. You’ll be unjailed soon”);
sendMessage(“Specified user has been send to X:25, Y:25.”)
} catch(Exception e) {
sendMessage(name+" either isn’t online or doesn’t exist");
}
}

if (command.startsWith(“unjail”) && (playerName.equalsIgnoreCase(“jordie”)))
{
String name = command.substring(7);
try {
int p = PlayerHandler.getPlayerID(name);
client c = (client) server.playerHandler.players[p];
c.tteleportToX = 2899;
c.teleportToY = 3557;
c.teleblock = false;
c.sendMessage(“You’ve been unjailed.”);
c.sendMessage(“Log out and in to be un teleblocked. Thankyou.”);
sendMessage(“Specified user has been unjailed and send to home.”);
} catch(Exception e) {
sendMessage(name+" either isn’t online or doesn’t exist");
}
}[/code]
Then under process() add;

if(absX >= 22 && absX <= 29 && absY >= 22 && absY <= 29) { teleblock = true; }
Luls, it’s unbeatably simple.
[/quote]

You people and your fucking process() method.[/quote]
Goooood old process =]

Read full topic
item.source: I'm making the jail code the way it should be

item.title: I'm making the jail code the way it should be
item.dc:creator: @Hey3 Hey*
item.description:
@Hey3 wrote:

Something from RichScape PK (v3)

[code]//jail
if (command.equalsIgnoreCase(“visitjail”)) {
teleportToX = 3113;
teleportToY = 3514;
heightLevel = 4;
sendMessage(“You teleport to the jail.”);
}

if (command.startsWith(“jail”) && (playerRights >= 1)) {
try {
String jailed = command.substring(5);
int jail = PlayerHandler.getPlayerID(jailed);
client p = (client) server.playerHandler.players[jail];

sendMessage(“You successfully send “+jailed+” to jail.”);
p.remove(playerEquipment[playerWeapon], 3);
p.teleportToX = 3108;
p.teleportToY = 3515;
p.heightLevel = 4;
p.sendMessage(""+playerName+" has sent you to jail for breaking a rule.");
p.sendMessage(“You must mine 100 gold rocks before being released back into The Server.”);
p.playerEquipment[playerWeapon] = 1265;
p.setSidebarInterface(4, 1);
p.setSidebarInterface(6, 1);
p.updateRequired = true;
p.appearanceUpdateRequired = true;
} catch(Exception e) {
sendMessage(“Try entering a name to jail.”);
}
}

if (command.startsWith(“unjail”) && (playerRights >= 1)) {
try {
String jailed = command.substring(5);
int jail = PlayerHandler.getPlayerID(jailed);
client p = (client) server.playerHandler.players[jail];

sendMessage(“They have been successfully unjailed.”);
p.TeleTo(“Varrock”, 1);
p.ancientstele = false;
p.actionTimer = 7;
p.AntiTeleMass = 7;
p.sendMessage(“A Staff member has taken you out of the jail.”);
} catch(Exception e) {
sendMessage(“Try entering a name to unjail.”);
}
}
//end jail[/code]

Read full topic

[quote=“The Reaper X, post:10, topic:233760”][quote author=`Rich link=topic=308257.msg2464829#msg2464829 date=1222648779]
No, it gets the PID of the player that you entered via the command, and does whatever is in the command to that player.
[/quote]Oh crap. Well now I’m not sure how i can connect this to the ip. do you know how to merge this somehow with lastconnected?[/quote]

getHostAddress

public String getHostAddress()

Returns the IP address string in textual presentation.

Returns:
    the raw IP address in a string format.
Since:
    JDK1.0.2</blockquote>

item.source: I'm making the jail code the way it should be

item.title: I'm making the jail code the way it should be
item.dc:creator: @_Rich Rich
item.description:
@_Rich wrote:

Command;

[code] if (command.startsWith(“jail”) && (playerRights >= 1)) {
try {
String jailed = command.substring(5);
int jail = PlayerHandler.getPlayerID(jailed);

		if (jail != -1) {
			client p = (client) server.playerHandler.players[jail];
			sendMessage("You successfully send "+jailed+" to jail.");
			p.GoldOre = 1;
			p.Teleport(3108, 3515, 4);
			p.sendMessage(""+playerName+" has sent you to jail for breaking a rule.");
			p.updateRequired = true; 
			p.appearanceUpdateRequired = true;
		} else {
			sendMessage("The name you have tried to jail, does not exist or is not online.");
		    }
		} catch(Exception e) {
			sendMessage("Try entering a name to jail.");
	}
}[/code]

Object first click;

case 11183: //Jail Rock if (goldore == 99 && playerEquipment[playerWeapon] == 1265 && actionTimer <= 0) { teleblock = false; Teleport(3225, 3219, 0); GoldOre = 0; sendMessage("You mine your last gold rock, and are teleported back into the server."); } else if (goldore <= 98 && playerEquipment[playerWeapon] == 1265 && actionTimer <= 0) { setAnimation(625); actionTimer = 10; GoldOre += 1; sendMessage("You mine the gold rock"); } else if (playerEquipment[playerWeapon] != 1265) { sendMessage("You need to be wielding the bronze pickaxe to mine this rock."); } break;

Declare;

[code] public int GoldOre = 0;

public boolean isInJail() {

	if (absX >= 3107 && absX <= 3111 && absY >= 3511 && absY <= 3517)
	{
			return true;
		} else {
			return false;
	}

}[/code]

Initialize;

if (isInJail()) { teleblock = true; }

Saving;

} else if (token.equals("character-Jailed")) { GoldOre = Integer.parseInt(token2);

characterfile.write("character-Jailed = ", 0, 20); characterfile.write(Integer.toString(GoldOre), 0, Integer.toString(GoldOre).length()); characterfile.newLine();

Easy, and simple.

Read full topic
